title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 March 2017 - XWiki
content:
<fwiesing> has quit  
01:46 <Alvis> has joined #xwiki  
03:05 <Alvis> has quit  
03:16 <Alvis> has joined #xwiki  
04:48 <Alvis> has quit  
07:08 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <upstrocker> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> has quit  
08:43 <upstrocker> has quit  
09:03 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <sgc\_072> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <mflorea> has quit  
09:43 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <faichelbaum> Hi guys. Do you know how I can debug/fix the performance issue in the DocTree when clicking no the node and not the pages ?  
10:05 <vmassol> tmortagne: do we need to upgrade http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HHardwareandSoftwarerequirements to mention that we require java 8 >= 1.8.0\_101 ?  
10:05 <vmassol> (good morning btw:))  
10:17 <tmortagne1> vmassol: maybe (even if using the last update of your Java version quite the minimum)  
10:17 <vmassol> ok I'll doc it  
10:18 <tmortagne1> Let's Encrypt is going to be used pretty much everywhere now that WoSign and Startcom have been removed from major web browsers  
10:19 <tmortagne1> (and from Java itself in last update)  
10:25 <vmassol> done  
10:29 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <acotiuga> Hello! I notice an issue in the snippets wiki. I just voted the "Date Picker for an input element" and as you can see in the above 3 xwikibot reports, the user is wrong even if I'm logged in with my personal account.  
11:01 <acotiuga> It looks like I'm the voter, but the author of the change is either tmortagne or superadmin.  
11:02 <tmortagne1> acotiuga: no, the author is not changed that's all  
11:03 <tmortagne1> the IRC bot just assume the XWikiDocument author is the one who did the change  
11:29 <faichelbaum> regarding the Nested Page perf issue in the doctree, the plugin Nested Page Migrator solved part of it : went from 22s to 11s but it seems it can't solve all of them  
12:03 <vmassol> faichelbaum: did you check what marius mentioned?  
12:03 \* vmassol sent a long message: vmassol\_2017-03-15\_11:03:48.txt - https://matrix.org/\_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/LyRlcazYQZhnDOBrvkHkaMRm  
12:16 <faichelbaum> @vmassol: didn't see it, will check  
12:16 <faichelbaum> also, does this error make sense for your when login with google ?  
12:16 <faichelbaum> Failed to execute the [velocity] macro. Cause: [No signature of method: java.lang.String.initialize() is applicable for argument types: (com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiContext) values: [[sdoc:GoogleApps.Login, com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.skinx.JsSkinFileExtensionPlugin:[...], ...]] Possible solutions: capitalize(), normalize()]. Click on this message for details. org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: Failed to evaluate Velocity Macro for  
12:18 <faichelbaum> Also, regarding your colleague message "10:51 <mflorea> if you have a recent version but you upgraded from an older version, then you need to make sure the XWiki.DocumentTree and XWiki.DocumentTreeMacros has been property updated, especially if you modified them previously.", how to check about it and therefore fix it ?  
12:19 <vmassol> "also, does this error make sense for your when login with google ?" I don't undestand the relationship with xwiki. You use the social integration extension?  
12:20 <vmassol> ie http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Social+Login+Module  
12:20 <vmassol> ?  
12:21 <faichelbaum> nope. using the Google App extention here  
12:21 <faichelbaum> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki%20Application%20-%20Google%20Apps  
12:21 <vmassol> link?  
12:21 <vmassol> I don't know this app  
12:22 <faichelbaum> ;)  
12:22 <vmassol> @thomas: btw the issues link is wrong in plenty of places... I guess that's when people don't use the proper parent pom...  
12:23 <vmassol> faichelbaum: it's contributed by Ludovic Dubsot but I don't if he's created a jira project for it, checking  
12:23 <tmortagne1> vmassol: if people have wrong lnk in Maven you get wrong link in extensions.xwiki.org yes  
12:23 <vmassol> maybe we need some protection  
12:23 <vmassol> I've just checked 3 and got 3 wrong links  
12:23 <vmassol> seems a common issue  
12:23 <vmassol> :)  
12:24 <tmortagne1> which ones ?  
12:24 <vmassol> faichelbaum: ok found the jira project I think: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/GOOGAPPS  
12:24 <vmassol> maybe you can check if your issue is in the list of opened issues: https://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20GOOGAPPS%20AND%20resolution%20%3D%20Unresolved%20ORDER%20BY%20priority%20DESC  
12:24 <vmassol> and if not report it  
12:24 <faichelbaum> sure thing  
12:24 <faichelbaum> thanks  
13:48 <faichelbaum> @mflorea: Hi, do you have more details about this please ? "if you have a recent version but you upgraded from an older version, then you need to make sure the XWiki.DocumentTree and XWiki.DocumentTreeMacros has been property updated, especially if you modified them previously."  
14:12 <sgc\_072> has quit  
14:27 <vmassol> faichelbaum: first what version are you on?  
14:30 <vmassol> if it's > 8.3 then what you can do is import the XAR from platform-index-tree-macro which will overwrite your pages: http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-index-tree-macro/ (you'll need to import a vesion matching your version of XWiki)  
14:45 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:47 <faichelbaum> sorry for the belated ansser (was on a phone call): I'm using 9.1.2  
14:47 <faichelbaum> checking your link  
14:50 <faichelbaum> XAR uploaded but no change. do I need to restart tomcat ?  
14:50 <vmassol> no  
14:50 <vmassol> I'm out of ideas...  
14:51 <faichelbaum> ok  
14:51 <faichelbaum> platform-xwiki-platform-menu-ui still in 8.4 . can it impact the doctree perf ?  
14:53 <vmassol> it should be 9.1.2  
14:53 <vmassol> I don't understand why it's not  
14:53 <vmassol> the DW should have upgraded you to it  
14:53 <vmassol> I don't see why it would have perf impact though but still somethinh is not right  
14:57 <faichelbaum> ok  
14:58 <faichelbaum> is there a good way to ensure that we use/have only packages in 9.1.2 and not in 8.x ?  
14:58 <vmassol> yes the DW  
14:58 <vmassol> it's made for that :)  
14:58 <vmassol> you must have skipped it probabmy  
14:58 <vmassol> you must have skipped it probably  
14:59 <vmassol> since when you upgrade XWiki it asks you to upgrade the UI (wiki pages)  
14:59 <vmassol> by DW I mean http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/DistributionWizard  
15:01 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <faichelbaum> any way to rerun it ? (reading the page)  
15:01 <vmassol> you can simply go the Extension Manager  
15:02 <vmassol> and search for extensions that require upgrading  
15:02 <faichelbaum> already checked for that with no luck  
15:03 <tmortagne1> actually you should install the extension "XWiki Enterprise Flavor - Main Wiki" in the right version since that's what the DW would have done  
15:03 <tmortagne1> since 9.1.2 is the last version you just need to search for it and install it  
15:04 <tmortagne1> it should upgrade what you currently have  
15:04 <faichelbaum> k  
15:04 <faichelbaum> testing  
15:07 <faichelbaum> it messed up with my user groups :(  
15:11 <vmassol> you didn't get any conflict UI?  
15:14 <faichelbaum> didnt see any error  
15:15 <vmassol> @thomas: do you understand what could have happened?  
15:16 <tmortagne1> no  
15:17 <faichelbaum> Failed to merge objects: previous=[] new=[XWiki Preferences] current=[Preferences]  
15:18 <faichelbaum> Collision found on object [Actility » XWiki » XWikiPreferences]  
15:18 <faichelbaum> Collision found on property []  
15:18 <faichelbaum> this is in the progress tab of the Flavor I just installed  
15:20 <vmassol> mflorea1: did you notice an issue with click() with Selenium3? It seems to not be waiting anymore  
15:21 <vmassol> (I could be hitting https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/issues/322 )  
15:23 <faichelbaum> du coup (entre autre), tous mes groupes s'affichent en "WebHome" dans le listing des groupes mais si je les edite, les infos et le nom sont bons dans la page d'edition. resauvegarder le groupe ne change rien :/  
15:27 <faichelbaum> need a coffee break I guess ^^  
15:42 <faichelbaum> I don't understand why the group listing does not use the group name anymore, following this addition :/  
15:53 <evalica> has quit  
15:58 <faichelbaum> Even if I delete on of those groups (as unused), I can't recreate it as another page has the same name, based on the error :/  
16:30 <faichelbaum> I fixed the group naming/permission issue by creating new groups. Though, none of the extensions added solved the DocTree perf issue (and even degraded things)  
16:58 <msmeria> has quit  
17:13 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:23 <sgc\_072> has joined #xwiki  
17:34 <acotiuga> has quit  
17:36 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
18:13 <acotiuga> has quit  
18:19 <vmassol> faichelbaum: sorry you're geting so many trouble. It's really strange though. You're not lucky, everone is very busy these days  
18:26 <faichelbaum> no worries. trying to figure out myself at the same time  
18:26 <faichelbaum> regarding the group mess, I got it sorted but it seems I have orphan pages somewhere (is there a way to manage it on 9.1.2) ?  
18:27 <faichelbaum> regarding the pages, using advanced users and review content (move/name edition/...) I improved the doctree perf. Still some glitches but far better  
18:35 <faichelbaum> so far, it's working almost as expected. my guess is that most of the issue comes from the upgrade 8 -> 9.1.2 but as I wasn't the one doing the upgrade, I have no trace so I can just deal with the result  
18:52 <mflorea> has quit  
19:32 <sgc\_072> has quit  
19:57 <Slashman> has quit  
20:01 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
20:19 <floflobel> has quit  
20:20 <Slashman> has quit  
21:53 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
21:54 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki
